wikipedia_page.main:
Maurice Robert Hely-Hutchinson   (22 May 1887 – 11 February 1961) was a Conservative Party politician in England.
He was elected as Member of Parliament (MP) for Hastings in East Sussex at a by-election in 1937. He held the seat until the 1945 general election, when he stood down from Parliament. During The Great Depression Hely-Hutchinson caused some controversy when he remarked that the long-term unemployed should lose the right to vote.His father was Sir Walter Hely-Hutchinson, the last Governor of the Cape Colony.
He was married to Melita Keppel, daughter of Admiral Sir Colin Richard Keppel.
